member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImageEventArgs.X
member.summary: X coordinate of the selection

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImageEventArgs.Y
member.summary: Y coordinate of the selection

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImageEventArgs.Width
member.summary: Width of the selection

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImageEventArgs.Height
member.summary: Height of the selection

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImageDesigner.AllowResize
member.summary: It's a dimensionless control, no need for resizing

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.GetUriStream(System.Uri)
member.summary: Gets a stream from the given HTTP URI. No redirect support

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Crop(System.String)
member.summary: Crops the original image and saves it to the specified path. If the specified path doesn't contain a valid image extension, it will be appended

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Crop(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Crops the original image and saves it to the specified path.
member.param: If true, the appropriate image extension will be added

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.RenderEndTag(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: We don't render anything for this control, it just ties to other controls.

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.RenderBeginTag(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: We don't render anything for this control, it just ties to other controls.

member.name: M:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.AddFileReferences
member.summary: Adds the jQuery, jCrop, webcropimage.js and jCrop CSS references as specified in the matching properties.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.ServerSizeResize
member.summary: If true, server-side resizing will be used instead of client-size resizing when display the image to be cropped. Only relevant when CanvasWidth and/or CanvasHeight are set.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.JpegQuality
member.summary: Adjust the default jpeg save quality. The default is 90, a very good balance with no visible artifacts.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.ForcedImageFormat
member.summary: If set, forces all images to be converted to the specified format instead of retaining their original format. Example values: "jpg", "png", "gif", null (default)

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.DebugMode
member.summary: In V5+, uses human-readable javascript files when enabled. Previous versions do nothing.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CanvasWidth
member.summary: The maximum display width for the uncropped image. If larger, the image will be scaled down (for display), maintaining aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CanvasHeight
member.summary: The maximum display height for the uncropped image. If larger, the image will be scaled down (for display), maintaining aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.EnablePreview
member.summary: When true, enables the preview window. You must also set the PreviewImageID value to the ID of a div or panel control.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.PreviewWidth
member.summary: The width of the preview div.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.PreviewHeight
member.summary: The height of the preview div

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.PreviewImageID
member.summary: The ID of the preview div or panel (NOT img tag). The preview div doesn't need to have any content.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Image
member.summary: ID of the asp.net Image control to be cropped. (Duplicate of ImageID)

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.ImageID
member.summary: ID of the asp.net Image control to be cropped. (Duplicate of Image)

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.MaxSize
member.summary: Maximum permitted crop size, in "w,h" format. See CanvasWidth and CanvasHeight for the maximum display size of the image being cropped.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.MinSize
member.summary: Minimum permitted crop size in "w,h" format

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X value for the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y value for the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.X2
member.summary: (Readonly) Gets the X2 value for the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Y2
member.summary: (Readonly) Gets the Y2 value for the cropping rectangle.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.W
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the crop rectangle

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.H
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the crop rectangle

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Width
member.summary: We're hiding the Width field, it's pointless, since this control doesn't render, just affects the rendering of other controls.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Height
member.summary: We're hiding the Height field, it's pointless, since this control doesn't render, just affects the rendering of other controls.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.ScriptPath
member.summary: The path to the folder containing jquery, jcrop, and the jcrop css file. Defaults to ~/scripts/

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.Ratio
member.summary: The aspect ratio to enforce on the cropping rectangle. Defaults to the original aspect ratio, but only enforeced if FixedAspectRatio=true. May be a fraction like 16/9 or a decimal like 1.3

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.FixedAspectRatio
member.summary: If true, the cropping rectangle will be forced to the original aspect ratio of the image (or 'Ratio', if set). Defaults to false. Not consulted if FixedAspectRatioCheckboxID is specified; the checkbox's value will be used instead.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.FixedAspectRatioCheckboxID
member.summary: The ID of a checkbox to change the FixedAspectRatio setting. If set, FixedAspectRatio is ignored; the checkbox's default value is used instead.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.IsInUpdatePanel
member.summary: Set this to true if the control is within an update panel, so the scripts can be registered properly. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.JQueryInclude
member.summary: Control how (or if) JQuery is automatically refereced. Defaults to Google CDN-hosted version, falling back to to embedded WebResource.axd method when internet connection or firewall problems interfere.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.JCropInclude
member.summary: Control how (or if) JCrop javascript is automatically refereced. Defaults to embedded WebResource.axd method.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.JCropCssInclude
member.summary: Control how (or if) JCrop css is automatically refereced. Defaults to embedded WebResource.axd method.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.WebCropInclude
member.summary: Control how (or if) webcropimage.js is automatically refereced. Defaults to embedded WebResource.axd method.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.ImagePath
member.summary: (readonly) The virtual path or URL to the image we are cropping.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.HiddenFieldClientId
member.summary: Returns the name of the hidden field used to store the cropped URL.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CroppedUrl
member.summary: Returns a URL to a dynamically cropped version of the image. Requires the ImageResizingModule to be enabled in Web.Config.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CroppedUrlQuerystring
member.summary: Returns a NameValueCollection of the settings used in the cropped url. Doesn't include server-side modified X,Y,W,H values, only client side versions

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CropXUnits
member.summary: Returns 0 unless ServerSideResize=True and CanvasWidth and/or CanvasHeight are set. The width of the display image; the size 'X', 'W', and 'X2' are relative to.

member.name: P:Imazen.Crop.CropImage.CropYUnits
member.summary: Returns 0 unless ServerSideResize=True and CanvasWidth and/or CanvasHeight are set. The height of the display image; the size 'Y', 'H', and 'Y2' are relative to.

member.name: T:Imazen.Crop.JQueryIncludeMode
member.summary: jquery include method

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JQueryIncludeMode.None
member.summary: jQuery will not be included - you must include it manually on all pages that have the control

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JQueryIncludeMode.Google
member.summary: First, the browser will attempt to load jquery from the Google CDN. If that fails, the embedded version will be used.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JQueryIncludeMode.ScriptFolder
member.summary: First, the browser will attempt to load jQuery from the folder specified in the ScriptsFolder property. If that fails, the embedded version will be used.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JQueryIncludeMode.Embedded
member.summary: Only the embedded version will be attempted.

member.name: T:Imazen.Crop.JCropIncludeMode
member.summary: jquery.Jcrop.js include method

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropIncludeMode.None
member.summary: jquery.jcrop.cs will not be loaded. You must include jquery.Jcrop.js yourself.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropIncludeMode.ScriptFolder
member.summary: Jcrop (javascript) will be loaded from the folder specified in the ScriptFolder property, with fallback to the embedded javascript

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropIncludeMode.Embedded
member.summary: Only the embedded javascript for JCrop will be loaded.

member.name: T:Imazen.Crop.WebCropImageIncludeMode
member.summary: webcropimage.js include method

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.WebCropImageIncludeMode.None
member.summary: webcropimage.js will not be loaded. You must include webcropimage.js yourself.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.WebCropImageIncludeMode.ScriptFolder
member.summary: webcropimage.js will be loaded from the folder specified in the ScriptFolder property, with fallback to the embedded javascript

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.WebCropImageIncludeMode.Embedded
member.summary: Only the embedded webcropimage.js will be loaded.

member.name: T:Imazen.Crop.JCropCssIncludeMode
member.summary: jquery.jcrop.css include method

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropCssIncludeMode.None
member.summary: No css for JCrop will be loaded. You must include jquery.Jcrop.css yourself.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropCssIncludeMode.ScriptFolder
member.summary: jquery.jcrop.css will be loaded from the folder specified in the ScriptFolder property.

member.name: F:Imazen.Crop.JCropCssIncludeMode.Embedded
member.summary: Only the embedded css for JCrop will be loaded.
